com.nokia.examples
Class NfcMenuForm

java.lang.Object
  javax.microedition.lcdui.Displayable
      javax.microedition.lcdui.Screen
          javax.microedition.lcdui.Form
              com.nokia.examples.NfcMenuForm
All Implemented Interfaces:
InfoInterface, java.lang.Runnable, javax.microedition.lcdui.CommandListener, javax.microedition.lcdui.ItemStateListener
public class NfcMenuForm
extends javax.microedition.lcdui.Form
implements javax.microedition.lcdui.CommandListener, javax.microedition.lcdui.ItemStateListener, InfoInterface, java.lang.Runnable

User interface and controller for the application.

Author:
Andreas Jakl

operationMode

private int operationMode
Current operation mode. Can be either READ_TAG, WRITE_TAG or DELETE_TAG.

READ_TAG

private static final int READ_TAG
When touching an NFC tag: the tag will be read.

private static final int WRITE_SP_TAG
When touching an NFC tag: the Smart Poster info currently visible in the form is written to the tag.

When touching an NFC tag: write an sms link to the tag.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

WRITE_ANNOTATED_URL_TAG

private static final int WRITE_ANNOTATED_URL_TAG
When touching an NFC tag: write an annotated url (url record and text record without Smart Poster meta-record) to the tag. Used by some Qt Mobility examples.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

WRITE_IMAGE_TAG

private static final int WRITE_IMAGE_TAG
When touching an NFC tag: write an image to the tag.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

WRITE_GEO_TAG

private static final int WRITE_GEO_TAG
When touching an NFC tag: write a geo URI to the tag. Specs: http://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc5870

See Also:
Constant Field Values

WRITE_CUSTOM_TAG

private static final int WRITE_CUSTOM_TAG
When touching an NFC tag: write a custom tag format.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

WRITE_COMBINATION_TAG

private static final int WRITE_COMBINATION_TAG
When touching an NFC tag: write a combination tag format: 1. Custom record (for handling with a custom content handler plug-in) & 2. URL (e.g., a link to the Nokia Store to download the app including the content-handler plug-in).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

WRITE_VCALENDAR_TAG

private static final int WRITE_VCALENDAR_TAG
When touching an NFC tag: write a simple, customizable vCalendar entry. Specifications: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2445

See Also:
Constant Field Values

READ_RAW_TAG

private static final int READ_RAW_TAG
When touching an NFC tag: raw data is read from the tag and logged to a file.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

WRITE_RAW_TAG

private static final int WRITE_RAW_TAG
When touching an NFC tag: write the newest data file to the tag.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

CLONE_TAG

private static final int CLONE_TAG

DELETE_TAG

Initialize the UI and the NFC interaction. To be executed from an own thread to ensure fast app startup.

Call-back from the choice group that selects the operation mode.

Specified by:
itemStateChanged in interface javax.microedition.lcdui.ItemStateListener

activateOperationMode

private void activateOperationMode(int newOperationMode)
Switches the internal operation mode between reading, writing and deleting tags. Also adjusts the UI in the form accordingly

Parameters:
newOperationMode - one of the defined operation modes (READ_TAG, WRITE_TAG or DELETE_TAG) that should be activated.

tagReady

public void tagReady()
Callback when a tag was found. The NFC manager will then establish a new thread and call this method, so that commands can be issued to the tag.

Specified by:
tagReady in interface InfoInterface

setupFormHeader

private void setupFormHeader(int oldOperationMode,
                             int newOperationMode)
Setup the UI for the new operation mode. Will show the correct selection UI element and the according instructions. All other UI elements are cleared from the screen.

Parameters:
oldOperationMode - operation mode that was active before.
newOperationMode - operation mode to be activated.

resetFormExceptFirstX

private void resetFormExceptFirstX(int numRemainingElements)
Clear all elements of the Form UI-element except the first few.

Parameters:
numRemainingElements - how many UI elements should remain from the beginning of the UI.

isWriteOperationMode

private boolean isWriteOperationMode(int operationMode)
Check if the specified operating mode is one that would write a tag (-> true) or one that reads / deletes a tag (-> false).

Parameters:
operationMode - operation mode to check
Returns:
true if the operation mode will write user-specified data to the tag, false if it reads / deletes the tag.

private java.lang.String getSelectedImageName()

Specified by:

displayAlert

public void displayAlert(java.lang.String title,
                         java.lang.String text,
                         javax.microedition.lcdui.AlertType type)
Utility function to show a Java ME alert, as used for informing the user about events in this demo app.

Specified by:
displayAlert in interface InfoInterface
Parameters:
title - title text to use for the message box.
text - text to show as the main message in the box.
type - one of the available alert types, defining the icon, sound and display length.
